intro: Schrebera saundersiae var. latialata, commonly known as the Cape jasmine, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a glossy appearance. The flowers bloom in clusters and are pollinated primarily by insects, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
